fields.value: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS):  Higher Education Finance Data, 1988-1989

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection contains information on finances for a sample of postsecondary institutions in the United States. The finance data, collected annually, are used for reporting and projecting capital outlays of two-year and four-year colleges and universities, trends in replacements of plant assets, and performance of endowment funds. Variables include fund revenues by source, expenditures by function, land, buildings, equipment assets, balances and transactions on the physical plant, endowments, and changes in fund balance.

topicClassValue.value: IDRC VI. Human Dimension of International Relations

seriesName.value: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS) Series

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Virgin Islands of the United States

value: All postsecondary institutions in operation in fiscal year 1989 in the United States and its outlying areas (American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Marshall Islands, Palau, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands).

fields.value: The survey was mailed to 6,572 postsecondary institutions  in the United States that were four-year,  two-year public and private  nonprofit, less-than-two-year public institutions, and an additional  sample of two-year for-profit and less-than-two-year nonprofit private institutions.
Checked for undocumented or out-of-range codes.
